entry.title: Armenia's renewed drive towards public administration reform

media:group.media:title: Armenia's renewed drive towards public administration reform
media:group.media:description:
In this in-depth discussion, Viktorya Aydinyan, advisor to the Deputy Prime Minister of Armenia, delves into the countryâ€™s public administration reform agenda. She examines the goals and early progress of efforts aiming to modernize governance, enhance service delivery, and improve policy planning. Aydinyan addresses the challenges of driving transformation across the government, and empowering citizens with a more participatory, digitally-oriented civil service.

media:group.media:title: Can Lake Sevan be saved?
media:group.media:description:
This week on Insights, Eric Hacopian is coming to you from the shores of Lake Sevan. First, he examines recent comments made by the US Secretary of State regarding the so-called peace process between Armenia and Azerbaijan. Then, Eric delves into environmental issues in Armenia, with a specific emphasis on water policy in a country facing geographic challenges.

media:group.media:description:
LÃ©a Hakim, senior country economist for Armenia at the World Bank, sits down with CivilNetâ€™s Mark Dovich to present her teamâ€™s new assessment of Armeniaâ€™s economy. They discuss why Armenia lags behind its peers in job creation, job quality, and job distribution. They also talk about how the country can address the mounting impacts of climate change, and what role diaspora communities can play in Armeniaâ€™s development.
